question[question_text]:
Consider a training set that contains 100 positive example and 400 negative examples. For each of the following candidate rules,

R1: A -> + (covers 4 positive and 1 negative examples),

R2: B -> + (covers 30 positive and 10 negative examples),

R3: C -> + (covers 100 positive and 90 negative examples),

determine which is the best and worst candidate rule according to Rule accuracy.

Select one:
question[correct_comments]:
Your answer is correct.

Techniques:

 

  • Brute force approach:
    • Try all possible feature subsets as input to data mining algorithm
  • Embedded approaches:
    • Feature selection occurs naturally as part of the data mining algorithm
  • Filter approaches:
    • Features are selected before data mining algorithm is run
  • Wrapper approaches:
    • Use the data mining algorithm as a black box to find best subset of attributes

 

The correct answers are:

Brute-force approach
,

Embedded approaches
,

Filter approaches
,

Wrapper approaches
question[answers][0][answer_text]: R1 the best candidate and R3 the worst candidate.
question[answers][1][answer_text]: R1 the best candidate and R2 the worst candidate.
question[answers][2][answer_text]: R2 the best candidate and R3 the worst candidate.
question[answers][3][answer_text]: R3 the best candidate and R2 the worst candidate.
